name: DN1210-SP2-003 ITP Temp works - Removal of Traffic islands and swale backfill
template name: DN1210-SP2-003 ITP Temp works - Removal of Traffic islands and swale backfill Rev 0

name: Detail - The Contractor shall submit the construction and QA methodology, for each element of Earthworks, incl construction, Site Access, dewatering, wet weather, testing, inspection and hold points for review and approval prior to works.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Confirm that the weather and environment will be suitable for works with the Environmental advisor.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to works commence
Detail - The Contractor shall submit the full details of the geotextile they propose to use to the Engineer for approval prior to installation.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Results to Engineer for Approval
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.11 - Weathering Quality Index
○ NZS4407:1991, Test 3.12 - Los Angeles Abrasion Test Result
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - As per specified criteria
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 2 Test per Source
Detail - Conforming sieve size and Mix designation refer to clause 3.3.1 and Table 3.5
Sieve Size (mm) || Mix Designation: DG7 || Mix Designation: DG || Mix Designation: DG14
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction and during construction

Detail - Drainage pipes used in subsoil drainage shall be smooth bore perforated Landflow 100mm diameter complying with NZTA F5 unless otherwise stated on the drawings. Pipes shall not have a geofabric filter sock unless requested by the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of pipes onsite with tag showing class
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Installation

Detail - Catchpits are proposed to be precast concrete chambers with grate and frames shall be cycle-friendly Hynds Hydro Stormwater Grate and Frame or approved equivalent for all local roads and the state highway
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Installation
2.1.1 - Cut Subgrade Testing - Cohesive Soil Scala Penetrometer
Detail - NZS4402:1988, Test 6.5.2 - Dynamic Cone Penetrometer
○ Scala penetrometer testing to be undertaken instead of shear vane tests where shear vane is unable to penetrate subgrade material
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 3 blows per 100mm penetration
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 test per 400M2
Detail - Visual Inspection of Proof Roll an d undercut surface
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Across Finished Area
Detail - A layer of Class B Geotextile Fabric is to be placed between the cut surface and imported GAP65 Fill with minimum overlap 400mm between adjacent geotextile strips.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geotextile to be placed across the undercut base and up the sides, with joints overlapped by 500mm minimum
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - As Required
Detail - Subsoils to be placed at base of cleaned-out swale to falls required to drain to existing road crossing drainage
Detail - All backfill is to be installed in 250mm lifts and compacted to the following standards.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Layer
Detail - ASTM D5874-16:2016 Clegg Hammer Testing
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 set (5 tests per 5x5m grid) per 1000m2 of placed per area worked each day, per lift
Detail - Layer thickness to be min. 40mm or approved by Engineer
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During construction
Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extent of all the work and locations of subsurface drainage systems and their outlets.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post Construction
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
